"SAL Logistics Services has renewed its partnership with Emirates SkyCargo through a strategic agreement to provide integrated solutions for ground handling, air cargo, and logistics operations in the Kingdom. The agreement aims to enhance efficiency and reliability in logistics services, ensuring faster operations and elevated levels of integrated air cargo services."
"21Shares has applied for a crypto-focused ETF tracking the Hyperliquid decentralized exchange's token, HYPE. The proposed fund would use Coinbase and BitGo as custodians and give investors exposure to HYPE, a digital asset with a $12.7 billion market capitalization. This comes amid strong demand for crypto-focused products and a friendlier regulatory environment."
"DaVita HealthCare Partners Inc. reported third-quarter profit of $150.3 million, missing Wall Street expectations, with net income of $2.04 per share and revenue of $3.42 billion."
"TTM Technologies Inc. reported third-quarter net income of $53.1 million, beating Wall Street expectations, with adjusted earnings per share at 67 cents and revenue of $752.7 million."
"Artist Random Acts of Kindness and label Better World Records have launched their new single, ""I Wish"", an angelic ballad about inspiring hope and positivity around the world. The song will debut live at the Breeders' Cup World Championships with a performance by the San Diego Children's Choir."
"Ferrovial, a leading global infrastructure company, reported solid results in the first nine months of 2025 with significant growth across all business divisions. The company's adjusted EBITDA improved by 4.8% year over year, driven mainly by U.S. highway assets."
"UBS' Americas wealth management arm saw a significant exodus of client assets in the third quarter, with $8.6 billion outflows, as advisors departed due to cost-cutting and compensation overhauls. Despite this, UBS reported a 26% increase in pretax profit and a 9% revenue growth."
"MiMedx Group Inc. reported net income of $16.7 million in its third quarter, with profit per share at 11 cents and adjusted earnings at 15 cents."
"The stablecoin market has reached a $300 billion milestone, according to Crypto.com's 'Chart of the Day.' The report by CoinDesk explores the reasons behind this benchmark."
"Business leader and pastor Ryan Binkley reported a massive fundraising haul for his campaign to win the Texas 32nd Congressional District, generating over $1 million from nearly 900 donors. His campaign received a boost from the Texas Path To Freedom PAC, investing at least $250,000 in support. Binkley's total fundraising is now over $1.3 million."
"Cyclo Therapeutics' TransportNPC Phase 3 clinical trial for Trappsol Cyclo is continuing after a review of prespecified safety and efficacy data. Rafael Holdings, Inc. reported its financial results for the fourth quarter and full fiscal year 2025, with a net loss of $12.1 million and $30.5 million respectively."
Meta reported third quarter earnings beating revenue expectations but falling short on earnings per share due to a one-time tax charge and increased capital expenditures for its AI buildout. The company's stock plummeted over 6% following the news.
"Meta's third-quarter revenue jumped 26% to a record $51.2 billion, but the company fell short of expectations due to a huge tax charge from President Trump's One Big Beautiful Bill Act. The tax charge led to a one-time, non-cash income tax charge of $15.93 billion and a significant reduction in U.S. federal cash tax payments for the remainder of 2025 and future years."
Summary of SUI 3Q 2025 Press Release and Supplemental
"National Bank Holdings Corporation declared a quarterly cash dividend to shareholders, increasing by 3.3% from $0.30 to $0.31 per share. The dividend will be payable on December 15, 2025, to shareholders of record at the close of business on November 28, 2025."
"Microsoft reported its latest quarterly earnings results, revealing a $113 million decrease in gaming revenue due to a 29% drop in Xbox hardware sales. However, Xbox content and services revenue increased 1% to $5.5 billion, driven by growth in Xbox Game Pass and third-party content."
"CandyWarehouse.com, a Texas-based online candy distributor, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection just one week before Halloween due to a sharp drop in revenue. The company's annual revenue is expected to drop by as much as 50% by the end of 2025."
"The third quarter earnings season is off to a positive start, with 29% of S&P 500 companies having reported results. Analysts expect a 9.2% jump in earnings per share, marking the ninth straight quarter of positive earnings growth."
"American Homes 4 Rent reported a key measure of profitability in its third quarter, surpassing Wall Street expectations. The company had funds from operations of $196.7 million and net income of $99.7 million."
"AvalonBay Communities Inc. reported a key measure of profitability in its third quarter, but it missed Wall Street expectations. The company had funds from operations of $394.2 million, or $2.75 per share, and expects full-year funds from operations to range from $11.15 to $11.35 per share."
"Extra Space Storage Inc. reported a key measure of profitability in its third quarter, topping Wall Street expectations with funds from operations of $461.1 million, or $2.08 per share."
"Cleveland-Cliffs Inc. has commenced an underwritten public offering of 75,000,000 common shares to repay borrowings under its asset-based credit facility and for general corporate purposes."
"Tenable, a cybersecurity exposure management company, reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding market revenue expectations with sales up 11.2% year on year to $252.4 million. The company expects next quarter's revenue to be around $251.1 million and has raised its full-year Adjusted EPS guidance to $1.53."
"NewtekOne, Inc. (NEWT) reported third-quarter net income of $17.9 million, surpassing Wall Street expectations. Revenue was $99.5 million, but adjusted revenue missed forecasts at $74.9 million."
"New Gold's mines are performing well, with the company reporting strong third-quarter operating results. The company produced 115,213 ounces of gold and 12 million pounds of copper during the quarter, with its Rainy River mine in Ontario seeing a 63% increase in gold production. New Gold's cash flow sharply increased due to higher production volumes and lower costs, enabling the company to pay down $260 million of debt."
"Microsoft spent nearly $35 billion on artificial intelligence in its fiscal first quarter, surpassing market expectations and overshadowing growth in its cloud-computing business. The company's Azure cloud business grew 40% in the July-September period, outpacing estimates. Total revenue rose 18% to $77.7 billion, beating expectations. Microsoft's AI investments have raised doubts about an AI bubble, but the company remains committed to building its own models and partnering with other AI firms."
"According to WalletHub, 46 out of 50 US states saw a decrease in average credit limits from 2024 to 2025. Wyoming had the largest drop, followed by Alaska. The decreases may be due to factors such as lower income levels and increased credit card delinquency. Residents with lower incomes may struggle to manage their credit, leading banks to reduce credit limits."
"Mountain America Credit Union's 2025 GivingTuesday campaign aims to provide crucial assistance to nonprofit organizations across its five-state footprint. The program will award $1,000 grants to 28 nonprofits, totaling $28,000, selected through community voting. Public voting opened on October 20, 2025, and runs through November 14, 2025."
"Nvidia became the first company to top a $5 trillion market valuation, reaching this milestone after President Trump's comments on optimism around Nvidia's sales in China. The company announced several partnerships and deals, including working with the US Department of Energy to build supercomputers and developing next-generation 6G cellular technology."
"Shares of Phillips 66 have been a moderate performer over the past year, gaining about 5%. The company has been in the midst of a long-term turnaround plan to improve operating performance at its refineries, and meaningful investment in upgrading facilities is beginning to show in results. The company's third quarter earnings beat estimates, with refining segment having adjusted earnings of $430 million, up $38 million from Q2."
"ServiceNow beat Wall Street's revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 21.8% year on year to $3.41 billion and non-GAAP profit of $4.82 per share. The company raised full-year subscription revenue guidance slightly and full-year operating margin as well."
"Syrian President Ahmad Sharaa announced that his country has attracted $28 billion in investments since the toppling of President Bashar Assad, with a focus on regaining regional and international standing. The World Bank estimates Syria's reconstruction costs at $216 billion, highlighting the need for international support. Sharaa emphasized the importance of investment over aid in rebuilding the country."
"TransMedics Group Inc. reported third-quarter net income of $24.3 million, topping Wall Street expectations, but missed revenue forecasts."
"Teladoc Health met Wall Street revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales fell by 2.2% year on year to $626.4 million. The company expects next quarter's revenue to be around $637 million, close to analysts' estimates. Its GAAP loss of $0.28 per share was 9.2% below analysts' consensus estimates."
Canoe Financial LP announced that two of its alternative funds were recognized with a total of six awards for absolute and risk-adjusted returns at the Alternative IQ 2025 Canadian Hedge Fund Awards in Toronto.
"After months on the picket line, 160 Teamsters have won their strike against Breakthru Beverage at facilities throughout Florida. The three-year contract delivers major wage increases, improved paid leave, and key union protections."
"The Notah Begay III Junior Golf National Championship Series returns to Koasati Pines at Coushatta Casino Resort in Kinder, Louisiana, for its sixth year. The Girls National Championship will take place November 2-4, followed by the Boys National Championship November 7-9. The event features increased international participation, elevated sponsor support, and a strong lineup of competitors."
"Mark Goulopoulos, Co-Founder & Non-Executive Director of PlaySide Studios Limited, recently bought AU$80k worth of shares at AU$0.20 per share, increasing their shareholding by a minuscule percentage. This purchase is the biggest insider buy in the last year and was made at a lower valuation than recent prices."
"Mastercard is reportedly eyeing to acquire blockchain infrastructure startup Zero Hash as the competition for stablecoin payments heats up. The acquisition could be worth $1.5 billion-$2 billion. Stablecoins are emerging as a cheaper and faster alternative to traditional payment methods, with projected growth reaching $1 trillion by 2030."
"NCS Multistage Holdings, Inc. reported profit of $3.8 million in its third quarter, with $1.37 per share and revenue of $46.5 million."
"Service International, a leading provider of death care products and services in North America, reported Q3 CY2025 results beating Wall Street's revenue expectations with sales up 4.4% year on year to $1.06 billion."
"Service Corp. International reported third-quarter profit of $117.5 million, beating Wall Street expectations, with earnings per share of 83-87 cents and revenue of $1.06 billion."
"Meta Platforms reported a steep drop in quarterly profit due to a $15.9 billion non-cash tax charge, with shares falling 8% in after-hours trading. The company warned of potential regulatory risks and forecast fourth-quarter revenue between $56 billion and $59 billion."
"Charlotte is experiencing a significant business boom, with over 2,000 new jobs and $199.8 million in investment expected from more than a dozen companies. The city has provided grants to notable names like Citigroup, SoFi, and Pacific Life, and its educational institutions are attracting businesses."
"C.H. Robinson Worldwide, a freight transportation intermediary, reported Q3 CY2025 sales that fell 10.9% year-over-year to $4.14 billion, missing analyst estimates. Despite this, the company's non-GAAP profit of $1.40 per share beat expectations by 7.4%. The company's operating margin has been trending up over the last 12 months and averaged 4.4% over the last five years."
"Glaukos Corp. reported a loss of $16.2 million in its third quarter, topping Wall Street expectations. The company posted revenue of $133.5 million and expects full-year revenue in the range of $490 million to $495 million."
Logitech International has filed its Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the second quarter of Fiscal Year 2026 with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
"Maryland's housing market is under pressure due to high demand and tight supply, with a C grade for affordability and homebuilding. The state faces challenges such as high land costs, lengthy local approval processes, and limited available sites, which have kept production far below that of its Southern neighbors. However, Governor Wes Moore has committed to addressing these constraints head-on through initiatives like the Housing Starts Here executive order."
"Meta reported a significant one-time tax charge of $15.9 billion for the third quarter of 2025, despite solid underlying numbers. The company expects a reduction in U.S. federal cash tax payments due to the implementation of President Trump's One Big Beautiful Bill Act. Net income plunged 83% to $2.7 billion, but revenue rose 26% to $51.4 billion, beating Wall Street forecasts."
"KLA Corporation reported fiscal first-quarter profit of $1.12 billion, surpassing Wall Street expectations. The company's per-share earnings are expected to range from $7.92 to $9.48 for the current quarter."
"Mid-America Apartment Communities Inc. (MAA) reported a key measure of profitability in its third quarter, but missed Wall Street expectations. The company had funds from operations of $217.3 million and net income of $98.6 million."
"ServiceNow Inc. reported third-quarter earnings of $502 million, surpassing Wall Street expectations with profit of $2.40 per share and revenue of $3.41 billion."
"EBay Inc. reported third-quarter net income of $632 million, surpassing Wall Street expectations, with adjusted earnings per share at $1.36 and revenue of $2.82 billion."
"MGM Resorts International reported a loss of $285.3 million in its third quarter, missing Wall Street expectations. The company's adjusted earnings per share were 24 cents, beating forecasts."
"The article discusses concerns about the job market and home prices due to the impact of AI. Weakening jobs data, layoffs, and softening home prices are causing uncertainty among potential homebuyers. The article predicts that interest rate cuts may not have a significant impact on mortgage rates, leading to a downward spiral in the economy and potentially falling into recession."
"Invitation Home Inc. reported a key measure of profitability in its third quarter, meeting Wall Street expectations. The company had funds from operations of $287.5 million and net income of $136.5 million."
"UDR Inc. reported a key measure of profitability in its third quarter, surpassing Wall Street expectations with funds from operations of $232.3 million, or 65 cents per share."

"Parex Resources Inc. has submitted a Proposal to acquire all outstanding common shares of GeoPark for US$9.00 per share in cash, representing a 44% premium to GeoPark's share price at the time of the Proposal."

The plan focuses on fostering high-quality development, scientific and technological self-reliance, and cultural progress. China is expected to accelerate its success through the integration of industrial, technological, and scientific capabilities."

The company has also announced that it has entered into an agreement to be acquired by Rithm Capital Corp. for approximately $1.6 billion."

The company became profitable within the last five years, and its revenue is up 7.7% over the same period. Despite significant insider buying, the share price return is down 43% for the year, while the total shareholder return (TSR) is a loss of 70%. Three warning signs have been identified for the company."

He noted that companies involved in AI have earnings, business models, and profits, making it a different phenomenon from the dotcom bubble. "A couple discovered that nearly half of their wife's $120,000 retirement holdings had been transferred from her Vanguard account to a Merrill Edge account without her authorization. The transfer was made using the Automated Customer Account Transfer Service (ACATS), which expedites transfers between investment firms. Experts say this form of financial crime is becoming more prevalent due to its speed and ease of exploitation."

"Boston's Seaport, a billion-dollar real estate development, is facing major flooding problems due to its location on filled-in mud flats just barely above sea level. A new study found that 99% of buildings constructed in the area over the last 25 years are at risk of flooding by 2050. Despite this, many real estate professionals remain confident that the market can adapt and that waterfront living will continue to hold its appeal."

The company's ROCE has dropped noticeably over the past five years, from 14% to 9.0%, which is lower than the industry average. This trend doesn't inspire confidence in the company's ability to create multi-baggers."

"Decentralized exchange HumidiFi is launching a token, WET, in November via an initial coin offering (ICO) on the Decentralised Token Formation platform. The ICO will offer tiered access to investors, with tokens available for employees and investors first, followed by Jupiter stakers, and finally public investors on a first-come, first-served basis. Tokens sold to the public will trade on Meteora immediately after the ICO ends, while those subject to vesting will be locked up onchain."

"Film co-production in Asia faces substantial challenges, particularly in cash flow financing. The team behind the five-country co-production of ""Morte Cucina"" discussed the difficulties balancing requirements from each country's film funds. Producers must contend with complex structures, shifting demands, and unpredictable changes in national film policies. They often turn to unorthodox methods, such as borrowing from wealthy individuals or offering premiums to investors."

However, Western Union's acquisition of Intermex, which uses Ripple's On-Demand Liquidity, gives them access to Ripple's infrastructure and XRP's rails. This move doesn't necessarily mean Ripple is falling behind, as they have established deep integrations with financial players. The competition between Ripple and Solana is not just about payments, but also about tokenized assets, cross-border settlement, global finance, and consumer rails."

"The article compares the PGIM AAA CLO ETF (PAAA) and the Janus Henderson AAA CLO ETF (JAAA), both focusing on AAA-rated CLOs with similar credit and rate risk profiles. JAAA suffered slightly higher losses during a market downturn earlier in the year, but these losses were mostly caused by a temporary discount to NAV and are not considered significant. The article concludes that PAAA and JAAA are effectively interchangeable investments with similar strategies, portfolios, and fundamentals."

"General Motors is laying off 3,400 workers at facilities building electric vehicles, including 1,200 employees at the Factory Zero Detroit-Hamtramck Assembly Center. The layoffs are based on seniority and were blamed on President Donald Trump's administration for eliminating federal support for electric vehicles. GM canceled plans for a $55 million hydrogen fuel cell factory in Detroit due to lack of infrastructure and transition issues."

"The Federal Reserve has cut its interest rates for the second time this year, but warned that a December rate cut is not guaranteed. The Fed also announced it will stop shrinking its balance sheet from December and reinvest maturing Treasury securities in Treasury bills."
"Bayou Fox Hooters participated in the Krewe of Priscus Charity Golf Tournament, raising $23,170.42 for the Escambia County Sheriff's Foundation to support public safety and law enforcement officers. The event highlights the company's commitment to community engagement and philanthropy."
"YouTube is reorganizing its product team into three groups to position the platform for an AI-centric future. CEO Neal Mohan announced a major reorg, which includes a voluntary exit program for employees. The company is introducing a new structure with Subscriptions Products, Viewer Products, and Creator & Community Products. YouTube ad revenue increased 15% in Q3 to $10.26 billion, beating analyst forecasts."
"KBRA assigns preliminary ratings to 60 classes of mortgage pass-through certificates from Sequoia Mortgage Trust 2025-S2, a prime RMBS transaction collateralized by 676 seasoned fixed-rate residential mortgage loans with an aggregate scheduled principal balance of approximately $554.7 million."
"Starbucks Corporation's fourth quarter fiscal year 2025 conference call discussion on Back to Starbucks strategy, Green Apron service standard, and growth prospects."
"Dynamix Corporation III has announced the pricing of its initial public offering (IPO) of 17,500,000 units at $10.00 per unit. The IPO is expected to close on October 31, 2025, subject to customary closing conditions."
"ViaOeste has signed amendments to extend concession terms and modernize contracts, resulting in increased revenue and adjusted EBITDA. The company's cash OPEX/adjusted net revenue was 38.3% in 3Q25."
"Mark Cuban, a successful entrepreneur, shares his experience with an all-you-can-fly pass he purchased in the past for $125,000. He weighs in on whether he'd buy a similar pass today if it were payable in Bitcoin or stablecoins, considering the potential cost savings."
"Scientex Packaging (Ayer Keroh) Berhad has a low return on capital employed (ROCE) of 8.9%, which is lower than the packaging industry average of 6.2%. The company's ROCE has fallen from 18% over the last five years, and it has been employing more capital without a corresponding improvement in sales."
"Hamilton Lane, a leading private markets investment firm, is expanding into the Taiwan market with plans to launch evergreen investment vehicles. The move builds on the firm's 15+ years of experience servicing institutional investors in the region and will provide access to private markets for Taiwanese investors."
"Renesas Electronics Corporation has announced its consolidated financial forecasts for the full year ending December 31, 2025. The forecasts are presented in non-GAAP format and include revenue, gross margin, and operating margin ranges."
"Renesas Electronics Corporation has announced its consolidated financial results for the three and nine months ended September 30, 2025. The company reported revenue of 334.2 billion yen and gross profit of 192.5 billion yen for the three months ended September 30, 2025."
"American corporations listed on the S&P 500 index have reported strong sales results in Q3 2025, with nearly 70% exceeding analysts' revenue expectations. This performance highlights the solid financial health of the US corporate sector despite macroeconomic challenges."
"Specialist Direct, a digital health solutions company, has announced a global strategic partnership with dacadoo to integrate their technologies and deliver a seamless continuum of care. The partnership aims to enhance recovery journeys and promote healthier lifestyles through the integration of Mira's case management platform and dacadoo's Digital Health Engagement Platform."
"Australian enterprises are adopting AI-enabled and hybrid contact center models to improve efficiency, compliance, and customer experience. They are modernizing operations to meet rising expectations for personalized interactions across multiple digital channels."
"Ascentage Pharma Group International, a global biopharmaceutical company, announced its participation in several investor conferences in November 2025. The company is scheduled to present at the Goldman Sachs APAC Healthcare Corporate Day 2025 and Stifel 2025 Healthcare Conference. Ascentage Pharma has built a rich pipeline of innovative drug products and candidates for cancer treatment, including Olverembatinib and Lisaftoclax."
"AM Best has maintained its stable outlook on Taiwan's non-life insurance segment, citing robust premium growth prospects and healthy operating profitability. The industry is expected to continue growing despite uncertainties in global demand and trade policy."
"Rigetti Computing's share price has surged due to hype around quantum computing, but its fundamentals are questionable. The company has a business model and economic moat, but its growth is expected to be slow until commercially viable quantum computers arrive in the mid-2030s. Investors should wait for shares to drop before considering a long-term position."
"Route1 Inc. is holding its annual general and special meeting on December 4, 2025, to receive audited financial statements, fix the number of directors, elect directors, re-appoint auditors, and consider a name change. Shareholders can access meeting materials online or request paper copies due to postal delays."
"Alaska Energy Metals Corporation has raised $1 million through a non-brokered private placement and is now in a strong financial position to execute on its immediate objectives for the Nikolai project, which contains nickel and other critical metals. The company plans to use the funds for metallurgical studies, access road permitting, preliminary economic assessment, and marketing."
"The Pernas Portfolio significantly outperformed the S&P 500 by over 23% in the quarter, driven by AI-related names and large gains in digital manufacturers. Despite a decline in RELY, fundamentals continued to strengthen. Small caps outperformed large caps, and investors are concerned about an AI bubble due to rapid growth and valuations. However, the author believes this is distinct from the fiber boom and bust of the 1990s, with AI-related CAPEX being more durable."
